concept.title: GRANT ROLE
concept.shortdesc: The GRANT ROLE statement allows in granting any RBAC roles to a specific user.

conbody.p: Roles can be of the following two types:

ul.li:
simple - which apply generically to all buckets/resources in the cluster.
For example, ClusterAdmin, BucketAdmin

parameterized by a bucket - which are defined for the scope of the specified bucket only. The bucket name is specified in parenthesis ( ).
For example, BucketReader(`travel-sample`), Query_Select(`travel-sample`)

conbody.p: Use of an unparameterized role with syntax of parameterized roles or vice versa will result in an error. For example, ClusterAdmin(`travel-sample`) or Query_Select will return an error.
Only Full Administrators and Cluster Administrators can run the GRANT ROLE statement. For more details about user roles, see .

p.codeblock: GRANT ROLE role [, role, ...] TO user [, user, ...]

conbody.p: RBAC-role is one of the RBAC role names predefined by Couchbase Server.
RBAC-user is the user name created by the Couchbase Server RBAC system.

p.codeblock: GRANT ROLE ClusterAdmin TO david, michael, robin GRANT ROLE BucketReader(`travel-sample`), ClusterAdmin TO debby
